page.title: 08GRANGE NURSERIES
page.content: Grange Nursery is situated on the old Woodham road. It covers in all an area of 24.5 hectares, two hectares of which is under glass, the remainder being put down to grass for hay. The nursery is wholesale only, growing bedding plants for the Spring and pot- plants mainly for Easter, Mothers Day and Christmas. The nursery employs 30 full-time people and about 35 part time on a seasonal basis. Of the area under glass, the largest house has an area of over 180 square metres. The houses are heated by hot water, generated by large oil burning furnaces. The top-soil being used at present is from the building of the new Woodham road, during the construction of which, the nursery lost 2 hectares of land. The nursery has been on the site since 1938, when it was started by the owner's father.
